validatesuggest 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Suggest a conditional rule

Source: R/assoc_rule.R
suggest_cond_rule.Rd

Suggest a conditional rule based on a association rule. This functions derives conditional rules based on the non-existance of combinations of categories in pairs of variables. For each numerical variable a logical variable is derived that tests for positivity.

suggest_cond_rule(d, vars = names(d))

Arguments

d

data.frame, used to generate the checks
vars

character optionally the subset of variables to be used.

Examples

data(retailers, package="validate")

# will generate check for all columns in retailers that are
# complete.
suggest_na_check(retailers)

#> Object of class 'validator' with 2 elements:
#>  NA1: is.complete(size)
#>  NA2: is.complete(incl.prob)
data("car_owner")

rules <- suggest_cond_rule(car_owner)
rules$rules

#> [[1]]
#> 
#> Object of class rule.
#>  expr       : if (driver_license == FALSE) owns_car == FALSE 
#>  name       : CR1 
#>  label      :  
#>  description: conditional rule 
#>  origin     : validatesuggest 0.0.0.9000 
#>  created    : 2021-07-20 09:36:24
#>  meta       : language<chr>, severity<chr>
#> [[2]]
#> 
#> Object of class rule.
#>  expr       : if (owns_car == TRUE) income > 0 
#>  name       : CR2 
#>  label      :  
#>  description: conditional rule 
#>  origin     : validatesuggest 0.0.0.9000 
#>  created    : 2021-07-20 09:36:24
#>  meta       : language<chr>, severity<chr>
